p: N. viridula stinkbugs were collected around Osaka (Japan, 34.7°N, 135.5°E) in May 2009 and transferred to Kyoto (Japan, 35.0°N, 135.8°E), close to the current northern distribution limit of the species in Japan ( 16, 19). Culture stock of the insect was reared at 25°C under a long-day regime (16 h light/8 h dark) and supplied with dry soybean seeds ( Glycine max), raw peanuts ( Arachis hypogaea), and distilled water containing 0.05% ascorbic acid ( 18, 22). For rearing experiments, egg masses were collected from the culture stock, divided, and randomly allocated to the experimental conditions.
